episodes.title: ADW 2025_Cynthia Finlayson_Alexander's Legacy & Cult: The Sibylline Oracle  & the Ideal Ruler
episodes.description:
CNEA's 17th annual Archaeology Discovery Weekend took place on 15-16 November 2025. This year's theme was "Alexander the Great and How He Changed the World." 

This is the second lecture from day 2, presented by Dr. Cynthia Finlayson of the LAPIS Foundation. Finlayson's presentation, titled "Alexander's Legacy & Cult: The Sybilline Oracle and the Quest for the Ideal Hellenistic Ruler," examines the enduring legacy of Alexander the Great, the Sibylline oracles with regard to the rebirth of Alexander and the enduring, cultic-like aspiration for becoming this ideal ruler.

Be sure to like, subscribe, and get notified of when the additional lectures and discussion groups drop! 

Visit our website to learn more about CNEA: https://lasierra.edu/cnea/.
To support CNEA, please visit: https://lasierra.edu/donate/.

00:00 - Announcements
00:50 - Speaker Introduction
03:14 - Lecture by Cynthia Finlayson
